Articles.Content:
Okay I need to know what's going on. Starting today, everytime I tried to fly my Saturn V. This happens. The camera doesn't follow the command pod like it used to after ~6000m. 

![sl1HUkn.png](http://i.imgur.com/sl1HUkn.png)

![zaT4qdP.png](http://i.imgur.com/zaT4qdP.png)

Please! Give me a solution. Thank you. I need to know what's causing this.

Is it just that ship? Looks like the game thinks the ship's center of mass is well below the actual ship.

I hate to say it, but you may have to rebuild the ship, or at least the stages below the one you show in the picture.
No it effects the upper stage only.

There used to be a stock bug that did this a loong time ago but was since fixed. I think all the recent examples of this have been triggered by add-ons. This is the unmodded support section, so I'm going to slide this over for now, and hopefully it'll get faster attention.

Cheers,

-Claw
this is triggered by certain parachutes such as vens stock revamp or that tiny little chute from i think tantares, the side mounted white/beige rectangle thing.

This type of effect was also seen in an older version of Kopernicus (fixed now) where the craft would hit an invisible ceiling that disconnected the camera from the craft at a certain height while only displaying a minor speedbump for the craft. Does this happen at the exact same height every time?
